The man bent over. He felt a pain in his back. He sat on the ground. The pain intensified. He screamed for help from the ground.

Dan was able to anything he tried. He baked a cake on his first try. He even got straight A's on his first report card. One day he failed at playing chess. He kept practicing until he was good at that too.

Jimmy went to lunch with his boss for the first time. Jimmy's boss wanted to have sushi. Jimmy was terrified at the thought of eating raw fish. He let his boss order for him since he didn't know what to eat. He secretly put his food in his napkin when his boss wasn't looking.

Matthew only liked the crust from pizza. His cousin O'Neil only liked the cheese. Their mothers bought one slice. They separated the crust from the cheese. Matthew and A'Neial ate the same slice of pizza!

Miss Davidson was Irving's favorite teacher in the second grade. What he enjoyed the most was when she would read to the class. This inspired Irving to become an avid reader. As a result,  Irving made excellent grades in school. After he graduated, he decided to become a teacher like Miss Davidson.

Kelly just got engaged yesterday. She couldn't believe how beautiful the ring was. She kept it securely around her finger, or so she thoughts. When she went to the beach today she ended up losing it. Thankfully though, the lifeguard found it in the end.

I went to the gym to lift some weights. I saw a pretty girl working out. I decided that I would impress her. I struggled to lift twice as much as I normally would have. I learned that I should never try and lift more than I am able to.
Scot was afraid of dogs. So he was nervous inside his friend Jill's house. Scott and Jill were at the computer. Then Jill's dog jumped on Scot. Jill laughed at how afraid Scot was.

How to produce a productive society. Stop giving children trust funds. If you give your children a job they will show you what their made of. They will find their place in the world. Equal pay for slave descendants and women is another story.
Tom wanted to read a book. He asked his friend for a recommendation. His friend suggested the Bible. Tom agreed that was an important book to read. Tom read the Bible.

Anna was reading a great book during lunch period. When it ended, she wasn't quite done reading. She decided to cut her next class and read in the library. But the librarian caught her and told her teacher! Anna got in trouble for cutting class.

Korine always loved the ocean. She had a fascination with all of the creatures that lived there too. One day she came across a beached dolphin. She called for help and got others to help her return it to sea. From that day on she pledged her life to studying marine biology.

Kristy loves to sing and play the guitar. She taught herself how to do both very well. She was asked to join a garage band with some kids from school. She memorized all the songs they had written. She now is the lead guitarist and lead vocals for this band.

Michelle had her Microbiology exam at 6:00am the next morning. She was extremely nervous. She stayed up all night studying. When morning came, she left for class early. She sat at her desk, feeling ready to take the exam.
Ricky's car wouldn't start. It was a cold winter day outside. It was the car battery. Ricky's wife drove him to the store. He was able to purchase a new car battery.

Zoey likes to play catch. She practices everyday with her dad for her upcoming game. On the day of the game she is very nervous. When the game starts starts, she catches the ball every time. Her team wins the game!

Lucy and Lisa had been playing with house paint. Lisa left and went back home. Now Lucy had to keep her grandma from seeing the paint. Lucy crept in the house while her grandma watched TV. She changed her shirt and joined her glad to have gotten away with it.

Mary and Shelley walked through the local graveyard. It was quiet aside from some birds and the wind. Suddenly, a hand grabbed Mary's shoulder from behind. Mary screamed. Shelley laughed as her prank succeeded.

Clara had wanted a puppy all her life. Her birthday came around and she finally was going to pick one. When she saw the little, one little boy seemed extra happy. She scratched his head, looked in his eyes, and picked him to be hers. Clara finally took her puppy home and was super happy.

I really wanted to adopt a cat. I spent hours browsing cat classified ads. My roommate was allergic to cats so he said I couldn't adopt one. I still browse cat classified ads sometimes. I still hope to get a cat someday.

Jack had saved up enough money to buy a new video game. He went to the store and looked for what he wanted. Jack found the game. He paid for it at the register and rushed home. Jack played his new video game all afternoon!

Matt lifted a rock up to see what was under it. A snake struck out and bit him in a flash. He held his bleeding arm and ran back to his house. His wife called an ambulance. Matt's hand eventually fell off due to the injury.

John and Mike went to a park to play catch. When they arrived, they saw two other boys playing catch. John and Mike started to play catch. And the other boys noticed them. The four boys decided to all play catch together.

For the third night in a row, young Jeremy had fallen out of his bed. His mom was really nervous he was going to be seriously hurt. Her friend told her to use a foam pool noodle to keep him safe. She put the noodle under the fitted sheet along the edge of the bed. Surprisingly, Jeremy didn't fall out of the bed again.

On monday our 2 year old granddaughter hit a child. The child was drinking from everyone's bottle. My daughter had a talk with her child. Today our granddaughter hugged the same person. My daughter was pleased.

Joe ordered a sub in the cafeteria. The workers prepared the sandwich immediately. Once Joe asked for lettuce, they tensed up. In addition, they added a small amount. Joe argued about the suspicion and requested the manager.
Meaghann saw a sign. Meaghann invited Chad to read the sign. Chad read the sign in shock. Meaghann begged to buy the house. Chad bought the house.
I was jogging down the road. My dad lives out of town. He saw me. He picked me up. We went for some Chinese food.

Yves wanted chocolate but his pantry was empty. The chocolate store was too far away. Yves decided to make chocolate instead. He grabbed some cacao beans and made milk chocolate. Unfortunately, the chocolate burnt and Yves couldn't eat it.
Larry wanted to find a new job. His current job did not pay enough. He was thousands of dollars in debt. He applied everywhere online. He eventually found a job that payed double his salary.
My friend got fired from her job. She was a teacher. She was fired for daring a couple kids to kiss each other. It was a boy and a girl. It took her a while to find another job.

Greg approached Gina while she was trying to go to class. Since her friends were around, she felt embarrassed. She pretended that she didn't know Gary. Although he was confused, he still tried to get her attention. She walked away with her friends.

Claire had always wanted to ride a large roller coaster. Her parents took her to a big theme park. When she looked at the roller coaster she was very intimidated. Her mother encouraged her to try it. Claire loved riding the roller coaster.

Tommy ate lots of sweets at his birthday party. That night, Tommy felt very sick. His mom brought him to the doctor. The doctor told him not to eat so many sweets ever again. Nowadays, Tommy eats fruit when he goes to birthday parties.

I saw my FB friend Sandra at the hospital. My son used to work in the bank with Sandra. She was accompanying her 85 year old father to the doctor. Her father fell and had hip surgery. She later reported on FB that her dad was recovering from the surgery.

Ben went to the store to get a 12 pack of beer. Ben paid for the beer and took it in a bag from the register. As Ben was walking through the parking lot the bag gave way. All 12 bottles fell and broke in parking lot. Ben just left.

Rina went to the hair salon. She wanted a change in style. After talking with her stylist, she decided on what she wanted. Rina opted for a natural bayalage in her hair. She was very excited to change her look up.
Tom hiked a mountain. Tom returned home. Tom walked through his home. Tom dragged mud through his house. Tom upset his wife.

I once had a pair of socks that were the most comfy in the world. I wore them every day because they were so comfy. Before long they began to smell. Eventually they got holes in them because I wore them so much. I ended up having to throw out my favorite socks because of the holes.

Lisa lost the bracelet her Grandma had given to her. She was very upset, and posted about it on Facebook. Her friends shared the post for her. Another woman said she found the bracelet! Lisa cried tears of real joy!

Laura had to babysit some kids today. She told me she didn't want to, but they made her! After she got there the kids said they missed her. She was very happy that the kids said that and started enjoying it. At the end of the night Laura tucked them into bed and left.

Jana just got a job writing for a newspaper. She was very nervous about messing up her first article. She worked all night to make sure it was perfect. The next day she nervously awaited the arrival of the paper. Jana's article made the front page!

Richard was reading his math textbook. All of a sudden, he noticed an ant crawling on his book. Richard screamed in terror! He threw his book in the air. The book landed on the ground and killed the ant.

A man at a party lied and told everyone he saw a ghost that night. Some people believed him and began to get scared and hysterical. Those that didn't believe him told him to leave the party. He left but came back later making ghost sounds outside. Even the skeptics began to get very freaked out.

It was a foggy night and I was driving slowly for safety. A car passed me and I could go faster following his lights. But my intuition told me I was going to fast so I quit following. A couple miles later, he had driven off the road. I might have followed him right off the road if I hadn't slowed down.

Sandra was relaxing at a coffee shop. She was drinking tea and reading her favorite magazine. A man came up to her and started talking to her. He was very attractive. He asked her on a date and she agreed!

Steve was excited about learning how to drive. His dad took him out to practice in parking lots and side roads. Steve was nervous at first, but soon became more confident. He passed his driver's test with no problems at all. Before long, he was happy solo driver.
Lisa was walking very carefully. She had a bunch of eggs in a bowl. She tripped on the carpet and fell. All of the eggs cracked! She had a huge mess to clean up.

When I was sixteen I ran away from home. I went to a town close to the one I lived in. I ended up staying with a person I didn't even know. The police found me and arrested me at a gas station. I ended up going home and finishing school.

Ann likes to play the violin. Her friend asked her to provide violin lessons. Ann tried to teach her friend how to play the violin. Her friend was not very good at it. Ann told her friend she shouldn't try to play the violin.
The debate was about to begin. The candidates took the stage. They stood at the podiums. They were eager to talk to the voters. The moderator took his seat and began the debate.

Kate was obsessed with her weight. She felt she was too fat. She did everything possible to lose weight. Eventually her doctor told her she was unhealthy and too thin. Kate had to go to therapy to force her to gain weight.

Jane's sorority were looking forward to white water rafting. They had planned the rafting trip for months. They made sure that everyone that was going were a strong swimmer. They even had signed waivers in the event of an accident. The exciting rafting experience went off without a hitch.

Mike loved venturing to forests. One day he found a tunnel in a forest. He took his friend anthony to explore it. They saw a ton of graffiti while hearing strange noises. Soon after escaping the tunnel, they found out the tunnel was haunted.

Gus attempted to tie his shoes. He gave a final pull and the laces did not get taunt. He looked at his work to understand what happened. Gus undid his laced and gave it another try. He pulled again and the laces got taunt.

Xavier and his friends decided to go bike riding one day. On the ride, Xavier crashed his bike into a tree. He touched his knee to find out he had scraped it. Luckily his friend Zac brought a first aid kit. Xavier put a BandAid on his knee.

Lebron needed a new laptop for school. He went to look at them in the store and saw they were expensive. He decided to start mowing lawns after school. After a month went by, Lebron had made a good amount of money. He was able to purchase a new laptop.
The woman made a stew. She threw everything that was in the fridge into it. Some of those things were rotting. She fed her husband the stew. The husband almost got sick.

There I was sitting at the beach on a beautiful California morning. Breathing the beautiful site and taking in the waves hitting  shore. The rain started, which reminded me it was time for work. Stuck in a box all day waiting for my freedom, I could still see hope. I returned to the beach after work and realized, I always had a choice.

I published a book of poems a few years ago. A friend who encouraged me to write the book had me over last night. As we began sipping our drinks I realized I saw a copy of my book. My friend was using it as a coaster on his coffee table! I laughed on the outside but wept on the inside.
Sam and Kim didn't know what to watch. They both wanted different channels. They started fighting over the remote. Eventually Sam punched Kim. Kim cried and ran to her room.

Kyle sat at his desk answering calls. But he was too loud and short-tempered on one call. His manager walked over to Kyle's desk. Next, his manager shouts, is that beer you're drinking? Kyle says, no, it's lemonade man!

Dave gave an apology to his US friends on behalf of Canada. Mark and Ricky didn't listen to his apology though. They were typical Americans, and beat Dave up. Dave ran back to Canada. Dave brewed some coffee and watched moose while he planned revenge.
I was playing a game of speed chess online. My wife texted me asking if I wanted ice cream. I texted back with my request. I ended up losing the game. I did not mind, as I got my ice cream.

Tammy hated being a waitress. Last week she almost quit. Customers walked into her job five minutes before closing. They demanded lots of food and left a poor tip. She cried herself to sleep two days in a row.

Jessie bought a new shirt. When she brought the shirt home, she found a hole in it. Jessie brought the shirt back to the store. The store allowed her to exchange the shirt. Jessie checked the shirt before leaving the store.

Brett loves making chocolate milk. He like to make his own. Sometimes he likes to put more chocolate than needed. He likes to make it for his little sister too. Usually he leaves everything a mess when he is done.

Betsy bought a new wagon for her kids. They had a lot of fun riding in it to go to the library. She would pile books around them. When they got home, they'd spend all day reading. Then they'd load the wagon up again and go back!

Ed and Sam were playing a video game together. They tried to kill zombies, but they always ended up losing the game. Then they went online and joined a party of 7 other players. The nine of them were much more skilled and able. Ed and Sam finally got to kill the zombies and win the game!
Dottie set the kitchen table. Her brother grabbed the dining cloth. He yanked the cloth off of the table. Dishes flew everywhere. Dottie and her brother went out to eat.

Thanksgiving was Mary's favorite holiday. Mary was preparing the turkey when she got a phone call. Mary was told her father was in the hospital. Mary went to the hospital and found that her father had died. Thanksgiving is no longer Mary's favorite holiday.
Ben bought four cans of blue paint. It was a beautiful day to paint his fence. His wife helped him. After they were done the sat on their porch and admired their work. Ben felt very gratified.

Jana was a terrible photographer! She especially excelled in taking pictures of her own hand. She was also really good at taking pictures of the ground. On her last vacation, she had a few good pictures on her camera roll. These, unfortunately, were all taken by someone else!

Tom's refrigerator stopped working. He told his apartment's maintenance department about it. They couldn't fix it for over a week. Tom had a lot of food spoil. The apartment complex refused to reimburse him.

One of my daughter's high school friends got addicted to oxycontin. She was 19 and had dropped out of college. She was so addicted she stole money from her mom and aunt. She checked into a rehab center under threat of arrest. She has been clean for five years now.

I was the smallest kid on my football team. I knew I had to work harder than everyone else. In practice I stayed late, until the coaches had to kick me out. In our first game I made three great runs and scored two touchdowns. After the game, the coach gave me the game ball.

Marie was terrible at keeping secrets. As soon as someone would tell her one, she'd tell it to someone else. Her friends told her many time to learn discretion. But Marie couldn't help it and still told every secret she learned. Eventually no one told her anything so the secrets were safe.

Joe went to an outdoor festival. He was feeling anxious since he didn't like big crowds. He noticed a horse that was giving rides to kids. He visited with the horse, petting its mane and talking to it. He became relaxed and was able to enjoy the festival.

Lucy had a pet watermelon in the garden. In the morning she ran outside to greet her pal. The stickers she chose for eyes had washed away in the rain. Upset she told her grandma what happened. Grandma laughed and decided they would use paint instead.
Julia went to a circus show. The acrobat swung high. He caught the ring above his head. He swung down to the ground. Julia loved the show.

Julie bought a 5 piece chicken nugget from Burger king. She drove home and smelled the nuggets all the way there. After she placed her meal on the plate she was very disappointed. She only had 4 nuggets in the bag. Julie went back to Burger King to get her last nugget.
Marion decided to stay home from work. She was scared of a predicted thunderstorm. The storm was as severe as predicted. A huge tree fell on Marion's house. She was trapped in her basement.
Tim's girlfriend always made fun of his hair. He thought it was just friendly teasing. But then he started wondering. So he decided to get a different haircut. She wound up liking him more after.

Tyler is moving away from his home town. He is going to California to become an actor. His brother threw him a huge going away party. He spent four hours saying bye to his best friends. He promised to stay in touch with each of them.

Sue was due to have a baby girl. She was very excited and wanted to pick a nice name. Unfortunately Sue and her husband couldn't agree on a name. They both wanted two completely different names. They came to agreement to combine their favorite names into one.

Aubrey loves to go hiking. Unfortunately she noticed an injured wolf on a trail. Aubrey felt concerned for the wolf and decided not to touch it. She called a nearby park ranger for help. The wolf was taken to a nearby animal hospital for recovery.

Sam was at the store looking to buy a television. He found one he liked and then looked it up online. He decided to buy it for a cheaper price online. Before he did a store employee told him they price matched. Sam bought it in the store instead.

Lucy's grandma was doing her hair after dying it. Her grandma put rollers in her long hair. Lucy had never seen foam rollers before. Grandma said the foam was soft so she could sleep on it. Grandma tied her hair in a scarf and went to sleep.

Maurice took a nap in the back seat of his car. He had been pulling long hours at the station. He heard a wrap on his window in the early morning hours. His partner lifted up a bag of Carl's Jr. Maurice unwrapped the sausage biscuit and sipped his coffee.

Melody has been asking her mom for a cat since she was little. Her mom finally broke down and took her to a shelter. Melody picked out a black and white kitten to take home. Her nose and face started getting puffy the second day. Melody is allergic to cats and the cat had to go back to the shelter.

Greg's family did not have internet service. To do his homework, he always had to go to the library. He made lots of friends at the library. His family eventually decided to pay for service. Greg still asked to go to the library anyway to see his friends.

Molly was very nervous about her son's first day of kindergarten. He was a shy boy who had trouble meeting new people. She walked him to his classroom. Before she had a chance to say goodbye he ran off to join some kids. She realized he was going to be just fine!

Chloe's boyfriend took her to a horse racing track for fun. He pored over all the data in order to make a prudent bet. Chloe, not understanding the numbers, picked a horse based on name. Though he had poor odds, the horse with the cute name won its race! Irritated, Chloe's boyfriend sulked for the rest of the date.

Gene despised having pieces of media spoiled for him. He liked one reviewer that always gave spoiler warnings. The reviewer forgot the warning one day and spoiled a film for Gene. The reviewer apologized for the oversight in their subsequent article. It was too late for Gene, who had already blacklisted the site.

Mark spent the day at the arcade. He found a pinball machine that gave out a lot of tickets. Mark played the pinball machine for three hours that day. His thumbs hurt, but he won 5000 tickets. Mark redeemed his 5000 tickets for a huge stuffed dog for his sister.
Alex woke up when the sun fell on her face. She debated staying in bed or getting up early. She decided to stay in bed. Her alarm rang twenty minutes later. She then got out of bed.

Wendy wanted to be a professional gamer. She knew she would have to join a team and play competitively. Wendy trained at her chosen FPS every day after school. When she joined a competitive crew, they found her skills lacking. Wendy was discouraged, but sought another crew to join.

Alicia carries her groceries into her house and locks herself out. She tries all of the home's doors and windows but they are locked. Alicia spots her son's first floor bedroom window as a possible entry. Alicia yanks the air conditioner out of the window. She sets it down and successfully climbs through the window.
Sue needed extra money. She decided to have a yard sale. She cleaned out her garage and closets. She found a lot of old stuff to sell. She made over $500 at her yard sale.

Jill goes lobstering with her father. When they pull up the traps that day Jill sees a blue lobster. She uploads a picture of the blue lobster to facebook. Jill and the lobster become local celebrities. A local news station even interviews her about the blue lobster.

Cole was going outside to play. He pulled his old gloves on. Then he saw that his hands had grown and they were too small! Cole carefully cut off the tips of the fingers. His new fingerless gloves fit him perfectly.

One day Ike's two-year-old son called him outside. He had been playing in the yard, but now he was hyper! Ike squinted to see what he was eagerly pointing at. Then he saw - it was a blimp! Ike smiled and explained the concept to his young son.
Tim wanted to play guitar. A friend bought him one for his birthday. Tim went online to look for educational videos. He tried a few a couple of times. Shortly after he gave up on the endeavor.

Bill starts working at WalMart. He is troubled when they force him to work off the clock. When it becomes a regular event he contacts a lawyer. The lawyer learns that WalMart is stealing from many other employees. He successfully sues WalMart and wins millions in a class action suit.

Jeremy wanted to go swimming one day. He put on his swimming trunks and went to his backyard. When he walked over to his pool, he noticed that the water was dirty. Jeremy grabbed his pool cleaner and cleaned out the mess. After cleaning out the leaves, Jeremy jumped into his pool to swim.

Ella went out to her parents' cabin to light a campfire. She stoked the fire until it was a roaring blaze. Then she sat in front of it and contemplated the nature around her. It was peaceful and very relaxing. Ella had a great time enjoying the serenity of the campfire.

We had a low hanging tree in front of our condo. The children climbed onto it often. One day a 4 year old fell from the tree. She was not hurt, but we heard a big thud. Her mother did not let her climb the tree anymore.
